intro: Adicea portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican adicea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
